intro: Cissus caustica, commonly known as the stonecress or rock fig, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are fleshy berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. Cissus caustica is often found growing on rocky surfaces or in shaded areas, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
